alert.note: Alert for Fresno; Madera (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 21 at 12:55AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by upstream dam release continues. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno and Madera. * WHEN...Until 100 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1255 AM PDT, An upstream floodgate release is expected to cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fresno, Mendota, Biola, Friant and Millerton Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
